scenarioDescription:
The K2-124 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-124 is a star with 0.39 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.39 times its radius. It is located 457.87 light years away from the solar system.

K2-124 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-124 system


K2-124 b

K2-124 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-124 b is 8.745 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-124 b is 2.900 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-124 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-124, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-124 - System With 1 Exoplanet
